title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the IDE is consuming more code than expected. This issue is illustrated in the following example:

The code is changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

Instead, it should have been:

baz(x.foo(), x.foo())

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the enclosed class.
2. Navigate to the bar method.
3. Observe that the code assist feature automatically completes the code to baz(x.foo().foo()) instead of the expected baz(x.foo(), x.foo()).
4. Manually modify the code to baz(x.foo(), x.foo()) to make the program correct.
The expected behavior is that the code assist feature should provide the appropriate code completion and not consume more code than necessary.
